description: Unofficial results in the race for the US Senate seat in Pennsylvania have triggered a legally required statewide recount, Commonwealth Secretary Al Schmidt announced late Wednesday.
title: McCormick, Casey Head to Recount in Pennsylvania Senate Race

description: The US Justice Department is investigating crypto predictions-betting platform Polymarket for allegedly accepting trades from US-based users, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Polymarket Investigated by DOJ for Allegedly Letting US Users Bet on Platform

description: Brazil is getting closer to setting up a regulated carbon market that will help to reduce emissions and expand forested areas after the Senate approved a bill on Wednesday.
title: Brazil Senate Advances Bill for Regulated Carbon Market

description: New York Governor Kathy Hochul plans to revive congestion pricing for drivers entering large parts of Manhattan, months after abruptly pulling the plug on a $15 charge just before it was set to start, arguing it would have strained working families and small businesses.
title: Hochul Plans to Revive NYC Congestion Pricing Plan With $9 Toll

description: The Brazilian president is looking to Beijing to help his country’s economic development. It’s a strategy that risks a run-in with Trump.
title: Lula’s Embrace of Xi Sets Up a Clash Over Trump’s China Policy

description: Presidente brasileiro olha para Pequim para ajudar o desenvolvimento econômico de seu país. É uma estratégia que arrisca entrar em choque com Trump.
title: Abraço de Lula e Xi é primeiro teste da política de Trump para a China

description: Brasil busca en Pekín ayuda para su desarrollo económico, lo que podría generar un enfrentamiento con Trump.
title: Lula quiere cortejar a Xi Jinping sin enfadar a Donald Trump

description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said the UK will introduce legislation next year to pool £1.3 trillion ($1.7 trillion) of pension savings into a series of “megafunds,” as the new Labour government tries to deliver on its pledge to boost private investment and economic growth.
title: Reeves Plans Law to Create Pension ‘Megafunds’ in UK Growth Push

description: Donald Trump’s return to power has raised the chances of another trade war between the US and China, making Beijing’s potential negotiators some of the most important people in Xi Jinping’s government.
title: Xi’s Key Players to Lead China in Another Trump Trade Fight

description: On this week’s episode of Voternomics, our panel discusses whether markets are really prepared for another round of Trumponomics.
title: Wall Street Wanted Trump. Now They Have to Deal With Him

description: In light of Donald Trump’s return to the White House, the NFL sent a memo to teams reiterating its policy on not allowing personal messages, including political statements, to be displayed during game days, according to a memo reviewed by Bloomberg.
title: After Trump Win, NFL Reiterates Ban on Player Political Displays

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at President-elect Donald Trump’s triumphant return to Washington. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: For Trump, Happy Days Are Here Again as He Returns to Washington

description: Chinese state-sponsored hackers perpetrated a “broad and significant cyber-espionage campaign” in which they breached multiple telecommunications companies, US officials said in a statement on Wednesday, confirming additional details about cyberattacks with major national security implications.
title: US Accuses China of Vast Cyber-Espionage Against Telecoms

description: Ukraine’s allies will look to pressure China over North Korea’s growing support for Russia’s war during a Group of 20 Summit in Brazil, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Ukraine Allies to Push China on Russia-North Korea Ties at G-20

description: President-elect Donald Trump is selecting former US Representative and one-time Democratic presidential candidate Tulsi Gabbard to be his director of national intelligence, elevating a loyalist and skeptic of support for Ukraine to coordinate the nation’s spy agencies.
title: Trump Taps Former Democrat Gabbard for Intelligence Director

description: President-elect Donald Trump says he is nominating Matt Gaetz to be attorney general, tapping a polarizing lawmaker to reshape US law enforcement and carry out his agenda on immigration, crime and hot-button social issues.
title: Trump Taps Loyalist Lawmaker Matt Gaetz for Attorney General

description: Republicans are poised to pave the way to expand fossil fuel development, roll back Biden-era environmental regulations and curtail President Joe Biden’s signature climate law after securing unified control of Congress and the White House.
title: Republican Sweep Opens Way to Boost Oil and Gas Development

description: OMV AG said it has received an award for €230 million ($243 million) plus costs and interest from Gazprom PJSC related to gas deliveries in 2022, boosting profit and risking future procurements from Russia.
title: OMV Wins €230 Million Award From Gazprom on 2022 Gas Dispute

description: Democratic Republic of Congo is set to receive nearly $2.9 billion in financing over the next three years after International Monetary Fund staff agreed to support two new loan programs with the Central African nation.
title: Congo and IMF to Agree on $2.9 Billion in New Financing

description: With President-elect Donald Trump and his fellow Republicans winning control of the White House plus both chambers of Congress in the Nov. 5 election, the Democrats will have one important tool for checking the power of the majority party: the filibuster. That’s the prerogative enjoyed by the minority party in the Senate to demand never-ending debate to thwart legislation, which must be approved by both that body and the House of Representatives.
title: How the Senate Filibuster Will Force Trump to Negotiate With Democrats

description: Republican Ken Calvert won reelection in California’s 41st Congressional District, according to CNN and NBC.
title: Calvert Wins California House Race; Republicans Hold Seat

description: World leaders who didn’t experience Donald Trump’s first merry-go-round are quickly learning how he likes to operate: If he wants to talk to you, there’s a good chance he wants you directly on the phone.
title: ‘Call Anytime You Want’: Trump Roils G-20 With Disdain for Rules

description: Republicans held on to their narrow majority in the US House, giving Donald Trump and his party unified control of the elected branches of government and limiting potential curbs on the incoming president’s power.
title: Trump Wins Republican Trifecta as GOP Retains House Majority

description: President-elect Donald Trump could jeopardize $7.9 billion in federal aid to New York City, posing “grave risks” to the city’s finances, Comptroller Brad Lander said.
title: NYC Finances Face $8 Billion Risk From Trump, Comptroller Warns

description: Marine Le Pen, leader of France’s right-wing National Rally party, risks missing out on the nation’s next presidential race after prosecutors sought an immediate five-year ban on her running for office at the end of an embezzlement trial.
title: Le Pen Risks Missing French Presidential Race as Prosecutors Seek Ban

description: President Joe Biden will meet his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, in Peru on Saturday for the last of three in-person sit-downs between the leaders during the US president’s term in office, according to senior administration officials.
title: Biden, Xi to Meet at APEC as World Leaders Shift Focus to Trump

description: The jockeying for Donald Trump’s Treasury secretary is spilling into public view, as Scott Bessent racks up key endorsements and the president-elect’s transition co-chair Howard Lutnick makes a play for the job himself.
title: Quest To Be Trump’s Treasury Pick Heats Up Between Bessent, Lutnick

description: South Dakota Senator John Thune, a longtime deputy of Mitch McConnell and an advocate of free trade, has won the election to lead the Republican Senate majority next year, setting up potential conflicts with President-elect Donald Trump over tariffs and Ukraine aid.
title: Senate Republicans Elect Thune as Leader, Rejecting Musk’s Pick

description: President-elect Donald Trump gave a full-throated endorsement for House Speaker Mike Johnson to retain the gavel in his first visit to Capitol Hill since winning the Nov. 5 election, where Republicans look likely to have control of both chambers of Congress.
title: Trump Backs Mike Johnson for Another Stint as House Speaker

description: Emmanuel Macron said the European Union should “synchronize” its financial regulation with the US, repeating his call not to apply stricter rules than others.
title: Macron Calls on EU to Delay Basel Banking Rules if US Does Too

description: Emmanuel Macron warned that Europe risks getting divided by Donald Trump’s economic policy and being thrown into a simultaneous trade war with Washington and Beijing.
title: Macron Warns Europe Is Hurtling Toward Tariff War With US, China

description: President-elect Donald Trump announced more members of his senior White House staff, shoring up the team that will help him implement his agenda as he prepares to retake power in Washington.
title: Trump Builds Out White House Staff as He Returns to Washington

description: Italian President Sergio Mattarella criticized Elon Musk on Wednesday for wading into Italy’s domestic affairs after the tech mogul lambasted judges in Rome for blocking a government plan to resettle some migrants to Albania.
title: Musk Should Stay Out of Italian Affairs, President Says

description: Michael Novogratz, the billionaire head of crypto investment firm Galaxy Digital, said there is a low likelihood that the US will set up a Bitcoin strategic reserve as proposed by President-elect Donald Trump.
title: Novogratz Says Odds of a Bitcoin Strategic Reserve Under Trump Are Low

description: OpenAI is calling for the US and its allies to work together to support the infrastructure needed to develop artificial intelligence systems and compete with China.
title: OpenAI Says US Allies Should Partner on AI to Compete With China

description: UK officials have warned ministers in the Labour government that previous trade talks with the US under Donald Trump were held up by his offer on tariffs, unwillingness to engage on climate-related issues and disagreements over access to public procurement markets.
title: UK Officials Warn Government of Hurdles Facing Trump Trade Deal

description: German conservative leader Friedrich Merz launched his election bid with a stinging attack on Chancellor Olaf Scholz, calling the Social Democrat a “lightweight” and accusing him of sowing division in Europe’s biggest economy.
title: German Opposition Leader Lambasts Scholz in Election Broadside

description: Italy’s state insurance and financial group will grant Saudi Arabia $3 billion in loan guarantees to help the kingdom develop a sprawling futuristic megacity.
title: Saudi Neom Gets $3 Billion Loan Guarantee From Italy Export Credit Agency Sace

description: Germany’s economy will hardly grow next year as underlying problems add to cyclical weakness, according to Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s independent panel of experts.
title: Scholz Advisers Slash German Growth Forecast for Next Year

description: Donald Trump’s selection of Pete Hegseth as defense secretary puts the world’s most powerful military in the hands of the least experienced leader it’s had in decades.
title: Trump Puts Allies on Alert by Handing Pentagon to Fox News Host

description: Laws prescribing that only products made in Switzerland can be marketed using Swiss images bring some 1.4 billion francs ($1.6 billion) per year to the country’s companies, a government-sponsored study found.
title: Made in Switzerland Laws Reap $1.6 Billion a Year Business Boon

description: Donald Trump’s election win is leading some forecasters to question if the European Central Bank will need to return borrowing costs toward highly stimulative levels as his threat of trade tariffs materializes.
title: Trump Win Prompts ECB Forecasters to Ask How Far Rates Can Fall

description: Global stocks edged lower Wednesday as investors awaited key US inflation data amid concerns that President-elect Donald Trump’s proposed ‘America-First’ policies will reignite price growth. Billionaire Elon Musk and entrepreneur Vivek Ramaswamy will lead a new Department of Government Efficiency tasked to “dismantle Government Bureaucracy, slash excess regulations, cut wasteful expenditures, and restructure Federal Agencies,” Trump announced Tuesday. The Opening Trade has everything you need to
title: Musk Gets Trump Adviser Role | The Opening Trade 11/13

description: US Ambassador to Kenya Meg Whitman has resigned following Donald Trump’s victory in the presidential election last week.
title: US Ambassador to Kenya Meg Whitman Resigns Following Trump Win

description: The German government said it wouldn’t be able to thwart an acquisition of Commerzbank AG by UniCredit SpA, highlighting the limited influence it has despite its fierce opposition to the potential deal.
title: Germany Says It Can’t Thwart Potential Hostile Commerzbank Deal

description: The UK government plans to leave scrutiny of Shein’s pursuit of a stock listing in London to the country’s financial regulator, sparing the Chinese fast-fashion retailer the sort of in-depth review of its employment practices that some in the Labour Party want.
title: Starmer Plans to Leave Scrutiny of Shein IPO to UK Regulator

description: Since Donald Trump won a second term as president, Wall Street has been rallying and Washington has been bracing for his return — but the real action is unfolding a thousand miles south of the White House.
title: Palm Beach Is MAGA’s Mecca as Trump Plans His White House Takeover

description: The Biden administration is committed to ensuring “every dollar we have at our disposal” is pushed out to Ukraine before Donald Trump takes office, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said Wednesday.
title: US to Rush Aid to Ukraine Before Trump Takes Over, Blinken Says

description: Turkey has been invited to become a partner of the BRICS group of emerging-market powers, short of its expectation that it would be granted full membership.
title: BRICS Stalls Decision on Whether to Admit Turkey as Full Member

description: India and the Taliban-led government in Afghanistan have taken the first steps to ease strained relations since the group seized power three years ago amid a chaotic withdrawal of the US forces.
title: India Takes Tentative Steps Toward Improving Ties With Taliban

description: US dockworkers are set to meet with their employers in New Jersey, resuming negotiations on the key issue of automation that sparked a three-day strike at major East and Gulf Coast ports last month.
title: US Port Talks Set to Resume With Trump Role Posing a Wild Card

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Who Will Really Run the US — Trump or Musk?

description: Conservative chancellor candidate Friedrich Merz said he’s open to reform Germany’s strict borrowing limits as long as additional debt-financed spending is used for investment.
title: Merz Opens Door to Reform Germany’s Strict Borrowing Limits

description: Bundesbank President Joachim Nagel warned that Donald Trump’s threatened trade levies risk derailing the German economy.
title: Trump’s Tariff Plans Could Cost Germany 1% of GDP, Nagel Warns

description: Senator Elizabeth Warren of Massachusetts is set to become the top Democrat on the Banking Committee, a prominent position for a top critic of Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, America’s biggest banks and the crypto industry.
title: Elizabeth Warren Set to Become Top Democrat on Banking Panel

description: President-elect Donald Trump returns to the White House Wednesday for the first time since his chaotic departure from office four years ago — and after a stream of key staff nominations that promises to reshape government.
title: Trump and Biden to Meet as US Government Gets Shaken Up

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said air-defense forces repelled Russian attacks targeting Kyiv and other regions in the first such assault on the capital in more than two months as his country prepares for winter.
title: Zelenskiy Touts Air Defenses as Kyiv Targeted Ahead of Winter

description: Emerging-market assets fell Wednesday as the dollar extended gains on a bet that Donald Trump’s new US administration will have strong support to push through his policies.
title: Emerging Markets Extend Drop, Hit by Trump-Linked Dollar Gains

description: Democrats thought the election was about bodily autonomy. For many voters, it was more about the price of eggs.
title: Oh, the Irony. Trump’s Triumph and the Next Four Years

description: The Philippine government will not object if former President Rodrigo Duterte decides to surrender to the International Criminal Court that’s probing his drug war and signaled it may also cooperate with the international police.
title: Philippines Says Duterte Can Surrender to International Court

description: Lebanon’s foreign-exchange reserves dropped for the first time in more than a year as the central bank spent dollars to prop up the pound after weeks of war.
title: Lebanon Taps Dollar Reserves to Support Battered Currency as Conflict Extends

description: Europe needs to strengthen its autonomy and improve its competitiveness following the reelection of Donald Trump, Greece’s Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis said.
title: Europe Needs Stronger Autonomy After Trump Win, Greek PM Says

description: Thailand is reviving a plan to impose congestion charges in capital Bangkok to tackle traffic and air pollution, a move that could make it the second major Asian city to implement such a policy.
title: Thailand Eyes Congestion Fee to Cut Bangkok Pollution, Traffic

description: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast, how countries across Asia are bracing for Trump’s return to power — from higher tariffs to potential geopolitical flare-ups.
title: Another Trump Term Is Coming. Is Asia Ready?

description: A second Trump administration looks like a disaster for the region. It might also—finally—shake the continent out of its torpor.
title: For Europe, the Next US President Is a Shock—and a Catalyst for Change

description: Rio Tinto’s planned $2.7 billion project in Serbia has triggered protests, but the country’s president sees it as critical to strengthening ties with Europe.
title: Fight Over Europe’s Biggest Lithium Mine Gets Geopolitical

description: Bulawayo’s mayor warns that the crisis may spark an exodus of residents.
title: No Water by Year-End for This Zimbabwean City of 700,000 People

description: Private donations to Ukraine’s military effort have plummeted, an indication that Ukrainians’ readiness to contribute to defense is waning as the war-torn nation looks warily to the future after Donald Trump’s reelection.
title: As War Grinds On, Ukrainians Donate Less to Their Military

description: A Swiss plebiscite to reform the health-care system hangs in the balance as final polls show supporters and opponents essentially tied ahead of the Nov. 24 vote.
title: Swiss Face Nail-Biter Vote on Health-Care Revamp, Polls Show

description: Somaliland holds a long-delayed election on Wednesday amid hopes a new US administration will back the breakaway region’s campaign to gain formal recognition.
title: Somalia Enclave Votes With Hopes for Trump’s Formal Recognition

description: Daim Zainuddin, the Malaysian tycoon who twice served as finance minister in former premier Mahathir Mohamad’s governments, has died. He was 86.
title: Malaysia’s Daim, Tycoon Who Became Finance Minister, Dies at 86

description: Republican senators returned to the US Capitol on Tuesday with their first consequential choice of Donald Trump’s new era in Washington hovering over them.
title: Republican Senators Face First Test of New Trump Era: Electing a Leader

description: North Korean soldiers have begun fighting against Ukraine alongside their Russian allies, the US State Department said, after Pyongyang sent thousands of troops to Russia’s Kursk region to aid the Kremlin’s war efforts.
title: US Says North Korean Troops Are Engaged in Fight Against Ukraine

description: Billionaire Elon Musk and entrepreneur Vivek Ramaswamy will lead a new Department of Government Efficiency tasked to “dismantle Government Bureaucracy, slash excess regulations, cut wasteful expenditures, and restructure Federal Agencies,” President-elect Donald Trump announced Tuesday.
title: Trump Picks Musk, Ramaswamy for Government Efficiency Effort

description: Donald Trump is nominating Pete Hegseth, host of Fox News Channel’s weekend morning program and an Army National Guard officer, as his defense secretary, the president-elect said in a statement on Tuesday evening, putting another fierce loyalist in charge of the government’s biggest agency.
title: Trump to Nominate Fox News Host Hegseth as Defense Secretary

description: A shortage of students willing to work at bars, restaurants or karaoke joints in the busy year-end season — even as pay rises — is a conundrum Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba must address to shore up his leadership.
title: College Kids and Karaoke May Be Key to Japan’s Ishiba Staying On
